page.title: 10FARMING IN RURAL RAMSGATE
page.content: Farms in the district are all arable ones.The crops grown are wheat,early potatoes,barley,cauliflowers and a variety of other crops such as oil- seed rape.There is no pasture land, only large hedgeless fields.The farmers are able to get two crops each year from their fields due to rich soil and mild,dry climate.Permanent staffs on farms are small and there is a great dependence on seasonal workers especially during the summer.In this area,the land is mostly fifty or more metres above sea-level and is well drained. There is no surface water of any kind. Each farmer has his own fleet of tractors,with attachments for ploughing,drilling and spraying,and his own combine harvester.Barley is harvested in May and July,wheat in August;potatoes picked in June and cauliflowers cut in June and November.
